Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: By the end of Foundation, students describe similarities and differences between themselves and others, and different emotions people experience.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They demonstrate personal and social skills to interact respectfully with others.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They identify and demonstrate protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies to keep themselves safe.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students identify how health information can be used in their lives.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students apply fundamental movement skills to manipulate objects and space in a range of movement situations.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students identify the benefits of being physically active and how rules make play fair and inclusive.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: By the end of Year 2, students explain how personal qualities contribute to identities.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They describe how emotional responses affect their own and others' feelings.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They demonstrate skills and describe strategies required to develop respectful relationships.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students apply protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies to keep themselves and others safe.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They explain why health information is important for making choices.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students apply fundamental movement skills in different movement situations and explain how they move with objects and in space effectively.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They describe factors that make physical activity beneficial.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students develop and apply rules while collaborating with others in a range of movement contexts.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: By the end of Year 4, students identify influences that strengthen identities and describe strategies to manage emotions, changes and transitions.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They apply skills and strategies to interact respectfully with others.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They describe the influences that inclusion and stereotypes have on choices and actions.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students describe and apply protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies to keep themselves and others safe online and offline.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They interpret health information to apply strategies to enhance their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students apply fundamental movement skills and demonstrate movement concepts across a range of situations.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They adapt movement strategies to enhance movement outcomes.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students examine factors that influence participation and propose strategies to incorporate regular physical activity into their own and others’ lives.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They demonstrate fair play and inclusion through a range of roles in movement contexts.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: By the end of Year 6, students explain how different factors influence identities.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They propose strategies to manage emotions, developmental changes and transitions.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They propose strategies to demonstrate respect, empathy and inclusion.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They explain how stereotypes influence roles and responsibilities.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students explain how communication skills, protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies keep themselves and others safe online and offline.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They analyse health information to refine strategies to enhance their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students refine and modify movement skills and apply movement concepts across a range of situations.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They transfer movement strategies between situations and evaluate the impact on movement outcomes.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students propose strategies to promote physical activity participation that enhance health, fitness and wellbeing.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They describe contributions they can make as a group and team member to support fair play and inclusion across a range of movement contexts.
